metadata.description: Hybrid pillars taxonomy combining MAPS-aligned strategic constraints with tactical variant intelligence and probabilistic modeling for Medical Affairs Intelligence Platform (expanded: full pillar implementations generated for all indexed pillars)
metadata.design_philosophy: Merge deterministic MAPS compliance (v3.0) with contextual tactical variants (v2.0) for both strategic planning and simulation
design_principles: Strategy expressed as constraints (eligible tactics, measurement requirements, lifecycle windows)
Explicit cascades with tactical variant intelligence
Region archetypes with bounded overrides and regional modifiers
Probabilistic priority weighting for Monte Carlo simulation
Contextual tactic selection based on stakeholder attributes
Resource estimation and ROI modeling capabilities

weighting_system.base_formula: final_priority = base_priority × lifecycle_modifier × therapy_modifier × region_modifier × resource_availability × evidence_readiness

lifecycle_phase_modifier.description: Multiplier based on pillar relevance to current lifecycle phase

therapy_area_modifier.description: Multiplier based on therapy area characteristics

region_modifier.description: Multiplier based on regional strategic importance

cascade_contract.description: Defines how pillars cascade constraints to tactics, metrics, and stakeholders

tactic_families.mechanism: cascade.eligible_tactic_families filters available tactics; cascade.tactical_variants provides contextual guidance

metric_levels.mechanism: cascade.supported_metric_levels and cascade.minimum_metric_level_required bound measurement claims

pillar_dependencies.mechanism: pillar_dependencies graph enables sequencing and resource optimization

pillars.title: Evidence Generation
pillars.description: Design, execute, and manage clinical and non-clinical studies to generate evidence supporting product value proposition and addressing evidence gaps

maps_strategy.strategic_intent: Build comprehensive evidence base to support regulatory approval, market access, and clinical adoption through systematic data generation aligned with unmet evidence needs

scientific_narrative.core_claim: Systematic evidence generation addressing critical knowledge gaps and supporting product differentiation
supporting_messages: Rigorous study design addressing key clinical and economic questions
Evidence aligned with regulatory, payer, and clinical stakeholder needs
Prospective data generation to complement existing evidence base
differentiators: Comprehensive endpoints addressing multiple stakeholder needs

phase_notes.prelaunch_T-48_to_T-24: Focus on pivotal trial design and execution; early evidence generation for regulatory submissions
phase_notes.perilaunch_T-24_to_T-12: Complete pivotal studies; initiate post-hoc analyses and supplementary studies
phase_notes.launch_T-12_to_T0: Finalize study reports; prepare for publication and dissemination
phase_notes.postlaunch_T0_to_T12: Conduct confirmatory studies and address emerging evidence gaps

prioritized_questions: What clinical endpoints matter most to regulators, payers, and clinicians?
What study designs provide most credible evidence for stakeholder needs?
How can we generate evidence efficiently while maintaining quality?

evidence_gap_criticality.measurement: Number and severity of critical evidence gaps

competitive_positioning.measurement: Need for comparative evidence vs competitors

resource_availability.measurement: Budget and operational capacity for studies

prerequisites.notes: Must have governance framework before initiating studies

synergistic.notes: KOL involvement improves study design and enrollment
Evidence generation feeds publication strategy

UK.notes: MHRA and NHS approval requirements; strong emphasis on health economics data

US.notes: FDA requirements most stringent; highest evidence generation costs globally

EU.notes: EMA and member state requirements; HTA evidence requirements vary by country

Eastern_Europe.notes: Lower costs; variable regulatory maturity across countries

LATAM.notes: Cost-effective region for trials; regulatory timelines variable

SE_Asia_Emerging.notes: Rapidly developing clinical trial infrastructure; growing regulatory sophistication

Middle_East.notes: Emerging clinical trial landscape; government support for research infrastructure

governance.notes: Core pillar requiring significant investment and long-term commitment

pillars.title: KOL Engagement & Advocacy
pillars.description: Identify, engage, and develop relationships with key opinion leaders to build scientific advocacy and influence clinical practice

maps_strategy.strategic_intent: Build network of influential thought leaders who understand, support, and advocate for product value proposition to drive clinical adoption and shape treatment paradigms

scientific_narrative.core_claim: Strategic KOL partnerships drive scientific credibility, clinical adoption, and treatment landscape evolution
supporting_messages: KOLs validate scientific rigor and clinical relevance
Thought leader advocacy accelerates practice change
Expert networks amplify evidence dissemination
data_of_interest: KOL publication history and influence metrics
Opinion leader treatment preferences and prescribing patterns
Guideline committee participation and voting patterns
differentiators: KOL alignment with product value proposition

phase_notes.prelaunch_T-48_to_T-24: Identify and establish relationships with tier 1 KOLs; engage in study design and protocol development
phase_notes.perilaunch_T-24_to_T-12: Deepen engagement; involve in data interpretation and publication planning
phase_notes.launch_T-12_to_T0: Activate advocacy; speaker programs, advisory boards, launch activities
phase_notes.postlaunch_T0_to_T12: Sustain advocacy; real-world evidence collaboration, guideline influence

prioritized_questions: Who are the most influential KOLs in target therapeutic area?
What drives KOL advocacy and support?
How do we measure KOL engagement effectiveness?

guideline_influence_opportunity.measurement: Upcoming guideline updates and KOL committee participation

launch_proximity.measurement: Time to launch (higher priority closer to launch)

kol_availability.measurement: Target KOL accessibility and engagement capacity

tactics: Real-time social media monitoring and engagement
Virtual advisory boards with interactive features
Fully disclosed interactions with transparency reporting
Fair market value (FMV) validation for all payments
Legal review of all engagement materials

prerequisites.notes: Compliance framework essential for KOL engagement activities

synergistic.notes: KOL engagement drives publication strategy and authorship
KOL relationships enhance field medical activities
KOLs contribute to study design and patient recruitment

UK.notes: ABPI code compliance critical; high transparency requirements

US.notes: Sunshine Act reporting mandatory; highest compliance burden globally

EU.notes: EFPIA disclosure requirements; member state variability

Eastern_Europe.notes: Lower engagement costs; emerging KOL networks

SE_Asia_Emerging.notes: Growing KOL landscape; digital engagement opportunities

Middle_East.notes: High-influence KOLs with regional reach; relationship-based culture

governance.notes: High-risk, high-value pillar requiring rigorous compliance oversight

phase_notes.prelaunch_T-48_to_T-24: Focus on pivotal trial design and execution; early evidence generation for regulatory submissions
phase_notes.perilaunch_T-24_to_T-12: Complete pivotal studies; initiate post-hoc analyses and supplementary studies
phase_notes.launch_T-12_to_T0: Finalize study reports; prepare for publication and dissemination
phase_notes.postlaunch_T0_to_T12: Conduct confirmatory studies and address emerging evidence gaps

prioritized_questions: What clinical endpoints matter most to regulators, payers, and clinicians?
What study designs provide most credible evidence for stakeholder needs?
How can we generate evidence efficiently while maintaining quality?

congress_priority.measurement: Strategic importance of target congresses to the TA

data_milestone_alignment.measurement: Alignment of data releases to congress timelines

budget.measurement: Budget availability relative to expected impact

prerequisites.notes: Must have governance framework before initiating studies

synergistic.notes: KOL involvement improves study design and enrollment
Evidence generation feeds publication strategy

UK.notes: MHRA and NHS approval requirements; strong emphasis on health economics data

US.notes: FDA requirements most stringent; highest evidence generation costs globally

EU.notes: EMA and member state requirements; HTA evidence requirements vary by country

Eastern_Europe.notes: Lower costs; variable regulatory maturity across countries

LATAM.notes: Cost-effective region for trials; regulatory timelines variable

SE_Asia_Emerging.notes: Rapidly developing clinical trial infrastructure; growing regulatory sophistication

Middle_East.notes: Emerging clinical trial landscape; government support for research infrastructure

governance.notes: Core pillar requiring significant investment and long-term commitment

pillars.title: Real-World Evidence (RWE) Generation
pillars.description: Design, execute, and manage clinical and non-clinical studies to generate evidence supporting product value proposition and addressing evidence gaps

maps_strategy.strategic_intent: Generate fit-for-purpose real-world evidence to address post-launch evidence needs, support clinical practice understanding, and inform future strategy.

scientific_narrative.core_claim: High-quality RWE complements clinical evidence and reduces uncertainty in real-world populations when generated and communicated responsibly.
supporting_messages: Rigorous study design addressing key clinical and economic questions
Evidence aligned with regulatory, payer, and clinical stakeholder needs
Prospective data generation to complement existing evidence base
differentiators: Comprehensive endpoints addressing multiple stakeholder needs

data_feasibility.measurement: Access to data sources and study feasibility
